title.narrative: Planning and Financial Management Capacity Building Program

description.narrative: Capacity in the Ministry of Finance strengthened for prudent, effective and accountable planning and management of public finances to promote growth and poverty reduction.

condition.narrative: Recipient has signed a contract with one FMO and an Adviser to the PIO
Recipient shall conduct capacity asseessment in Admin/IT Directorate and associated Advisers in first 6 months of effectiveness.Management support will be maintained or increased if necessary.
Recipient shall ensure that during the execution of the Project, at least one Procurement Adviser as agreed between both partieswill work under the Project
Recipient shall maintain Admin&IT Directorate in MoPF with functions substantially same to those in place at signing of Agreementand be responsible for overall implementation.
Recipient shall make its best efforts in signing a SoU with participating donors.
Recipient shall monitor and evaluate progress and prepare project reports in accordance with 4.08 of the General Conditions and onbasis of agreed indicators. Each report shall cover one trimester.
Recipient shall, by June of each year until project completion furnish detailed action plan for clearance for project components.
The recipient shall maintain until completion of the Project, a competent and qualified program implementation team comprised of aSenior Program Manager, a Senior Adviser Human Resources, and an FMO.
